intro: Senecio asperifolius, commonly known as the roughleaf senecio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has hairy, rough-textured leaves that give it its common name, and it produces small yellow flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Senecio asperifolius is also noted for its ability to tolerate dry conditions, making it a hardy species in arid environments.
